item.title: European markets close lower as central banks take center stage; coffee maker JDE Peet's falls 6%
item.description: European stocks closed lower on Tuesday, with market participants awaiting monetary policy decisions from major central banks this week.

item.title: China wants to dominate in AI — and some of its models are already beating their U.S. rivals
item.description: Chinese AI models are already hugely popular and are keeping pace with — and even surpassing — some U.S. rivals, industry experts told CNBC.

item.title: UK kicks off review into training AI models on copyrighted content
item.description: The U.K. government said Tuesday it's consulting on measures to regulate the use of copyrighted content by tech companies to train their AI models.

item.title: Germany’s auto giants were already reeling. Now Trump wants to turn them into American companies
item.description: For Germany, the prospect of U.S. tariffs on European autos comes at a time when it's top original equipment manufacturers are already reeling.

item.title: Nvidia falls deeper into correction territory, Broadcom reverses earlier gains to tick lower
item.description: Despite Nvidia's recent fall, its stock is still up more than 160% for the year. Broadcom has risen more than 120% in the same time frame.
